page.title: 01WESTON, NR. HITCHIN, HERTS.
page.content: {Weston}is a pleasant{village}situated in{chalk hills}surrounded by the towns of Letchworth, Baldock and Stevenage in{North Hertfordshire.}It is a Parish in the{Diocese of St.Albans}and has its own church. On the electoral roll there are{776 voters,}as well as approximately{200 children}and{100 {others}under 18. The area of Weston is approximately{5230 acres}mainly farm land growing cereal crops, rape and beans. The village stands{484 feet above sea level. There are five lanes leading to the village, occasionally they are blocked by snow in winter. The height of Weston gives a good view to the west over Letchworth from Lannock Hill. Now developing as a {commuter belt}the village is served by the{A1M Motorway}and an electrified main{railway}to London, both within three miles.
